company.name: TDARX, Inc.
company.address: 4000 Brownsboro Rd, Winston Salem, North Carolina 27106
company.business_description: TDARX, Inc. provides IT management and security services through the websites https://www.tdarx.com and http://www.nocdoc.com.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: TDARX, Inc., an IT management and security services provider, claimed on its website that it participated in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. However, after obtaining Privacy Shield certification in 2017, the company allowed its certification to lapse in 2018 but continued to represent that it participated in the program. The company also failed to comply with required annual verification requirements during its participation and did not affirm its commitment to continue protecting personal information collected while in the program after its certification lapsed.

representations_made.description: Claimed to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
representations_made.quoted_text: In compliance with the Privacy Shield Principles, NOCDOC commits to resolve complaints about our collection or use of your personal information. EU individuals with inquiries or complaints regarding our Private Shield policy should first contact NOCDOC at: CustomerCare@nocdoc.com or fill out a form at http://www.nocdoc.com/contact.aspx

representations_made.description: Claimed commitment to cooperate with EU data protection authorities regarding Privacy Shield complaints
representations_made.quoted_text: NOCDOC has further committed to cooperate with EU data protection authorities (DPAs) with regard to unresolved Privacy Shield complaints concerning human resources data transferred from the EU in the context of the employment relationship.

counts.title: Privacy Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a current participant in the EU-U.S Privacy Shield framework
counts.fact: After its certification lapsed in 2018, Respondent was not a current participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 15 is false or misleading.

counts.title: Misrepresentation Regarding Verification
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it complied with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield principles
counts.fact: Respondent failed to comply with the verification requirement during the time it participated in the program
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 17 is false or misleading.

counts.title: Misrepresentation Regarding Continuing Obligations
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it complied with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework principles, which include a requirement that if it ceased to participate, it must affirm to Commerce that it will continue to apply the principles to personal information received during participation
counts.fact: Respondent did not affirm to Commerce that it will continue to apply the principles to personal information that it received during the time it participated in the program
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 19 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: TDARX, Inc., a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, compliance with, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in or compliance with privacy programs including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, and the APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

provisions.title: Requirement to Meet Continuing Obligations Under Privacy Shield
provisions.summary: Respondent must either affirm to the Department of Commerce that it will continue to apply Privacy Shield principles or protect information by other authorized means, or return or delete the information.

requirements.description: Affirm to Department of Commerce within 10 days and annually thereafter that it will continue to apply EU-U.S. Privacy Shield principles to personal information received while participating in Privacy Shield
requirements.quoted_text: affirm to the Department of Commerce, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order and on an annual basis thereafter for as long as it retains such information, that it will continue to apply the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework principles to the personal information it received while it participated in the Privacy Shield

requirements.description: Alternatively, protect the information by another means authorized under EU law, including binding corporate rule or standard contractual clauses
requirements.quoted_text: protect the information by another means authorized under EU law, including by using a binding corporate rule or a contract that fully reflects the requirements of the relevant standard contractual clauses adopted by the European Commission

requirements.description: Alternatively, return or delete the information within 10 days
requirements.quoted_text: return or delete the information within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit acknowledgment of receipt to the Commission, deliver copies to personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments from them.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities, and agents for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: For ten (10) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt from each individual or entity that received a copy
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit compliance reports and notices to the Commission regarding business information, compliance status, and any structural changes.

requirements.description: Submit initial compliance report 60 days after issuance, including contact information, business details, compliance status, and acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or structure of Respondent
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding within 14 days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: All submissions required to be sworn under penalty of perjury must comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746
requirements.quoted_text: Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: "I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____" and supplying the date, signatory's full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific records for designated periods, including accounting records, personnel records, compliance records, and copies of representations.

requirements.description: Create accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold for 10 years after issuance and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for ten (10) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold

requirements.description: Create personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title, dates of service, and reason for termination for 10 years after issuance and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination

requirements.description: Create all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of Order for 10 years after issuance and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission

requirements.description: Create and retain copies of each widely disseminated representation subject to Order and materials relied upon for 10 years after issuance and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, record inspection, personnel interviews, and other lawful investigative means.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports or requested information and produce records within 10 days of written request from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written requestfrom a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Allow Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and permit interviews of affiliated persons who agree
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Commission may use all lawful means including posing as consumers or other entities without identification or notice
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order becomes effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on January 23, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates January 23, 2040 or 20 years from most recent complaint filing
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
